duties_responsibilities.duty: Deliver high quality, patient-centered care by performing basic patient care services under the supervision of a registered nurse.
Obtain and record patient information, including vital signs, height and weight, blood pressure, oxygen saturation, blood glucose levels, and intake/output.
Assist with patient mobility, transfers, and use of medical devices.
Provide non-medicated support care, such as dressing changes, skin protection, application of heat or ice, and venous compression.
Assist in specimen collection and ensure accuracy of labeling and timely transfer of specimens.
Retrieve and deliver supplies, assist with patient preparation for procedures, and orient patients and families to the hospital routine.
Assist patients with activities of daily living, perform hourly rounding, and respond to patient needs and requests.
Follow patient and employee safety/security policies and protocols, prepare and maintain clean patient rooms, and assist with post-mortem care.
Perform clerical work, including assembling and maintaining charts, filing, answering phones, and relaying messages.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma, GED, or Equivalent
